title: Chasuble, mid-17th century
medium:
Medium: linen
Technique: needlework on knotted net
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Front and back panels for a chasuble in a similar design. On front panel, the names "Antonius" and "Matthaei," while the back panel has an image of Saint Barbara holding an architectural structure in her right hand and a palm leaf in her left. There are areas of identically composed design on both panels with pairs of winged putti and angels set within a large-scale arrangement, emerging from an urn of floral and foliated scroll pattern, surrounding a large medallion which contains a floral spray.

tombstone.epitaph:
Chasuble, mid-17th century.Medium: linen
Technique: needlework on knotted net. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-50-184-a,b.
